meanings.definition: An officer of the British royal household who attends or assists members of the royal family.
meanings.sent1: The equerry accompanied the queen to the event.
meanings.sent2: The equerry took care of the royal horses.
meanings.sent3: The equerry tried to teach the queen's corgi to dance.
meanings.sent4: The equerry's loyalty was as steadfast as a castle wall.
meanings.sent5: The equerry's uniform gleamed with royal pride.

meanings.definition: A groom or stableman in a royal or noble household.
meanings.sent1: The equerry brushed the horses' coats until they shone.
meanings.sent2: The equerry mucked out the stables every morning.
meanings.sent3: The equerry accidentally spilled oats all over the stable floor.
meanings.sent4: The equerry's hands were as gentle as a summer breeze with the horses.
meanings.sent5: The equerry's whistle could be heard throughout the royal stables.
